Package nl.pim16aap2.bigdoors.commands

Class BaseCommand

java.lang.Object
nl.pim16aap2.bigdoors.commands.BaseCommand
Direct Known Subclasses:
Cancel, Confirm, Debug, DoorTargetCommand, InspectPowerBlock, ListDoors, Menu, NewDoor, Restart, SetName, Specify, StopDoors, Toggle, Version
public abstract class BaseCommand extends Object
Represents the base BigDoors command.

This handles all the basics shared by all commands and contains some utility methods for common actions.

Author:
Pim

  • Constructor Details

    • BaseCommand

      public BaseCommand(ICommandSender commandSender, ILocalizer localizer)

  • Method Details

    • getCommand

      public abstract CommandDefinition getCommand()
      Gets the CommandDefinition that contains the definition of this BaseCommand.
      Returns:
      The CommandDefinition that contains the definition of this BaseCommand.

    • validInput

      protected boolean validInput()
      Checks if the input is valid before starting any potentially expensive tasks.
      Returns:
      True if the input is valid.

    • hasAccessToAttribute

      protected boolean hasAccessToAttribute(AbstractDoor door, DoorAttribute doorAttribute, boolean hasBypassPermission)
      Checks if the commandSender has access to a given DoorAttribute for a given door.
      Parameters:
      door - The door to check.
      doorAttribute - The DoorAttribute to check.
      hasBypassPermission - Whether the commandSender has bypass permission or not.
      Returns:
      True if the command sender has access to the provided attribute for the given door.

    • availableForPlayers

      protected boolean availableForPlayers()
      Checks if this BaseCommand is available for IPPlayers.
      Returns:
      True if an IPPlayer can execute this command.

    • availableForNonPlayers

      protected boolean availableForNonPlayers()
      Checks if this BaseCommand is available for non-IPPlayers (e.g. the server).
      Returns:
      True if a non-IPPlayer can execute this command.

    • run

      protected final CompletableFuture<Boolean> run()
      Creates (but does not execute!) a new command if certain criteria are met (i.e. the ICommandSender has access and validInput() returns true).
      Returns:
      True if the command could be executed successfully or if the command execution failed through no fault of the ICommandSender.

    • handleDatabaseActionResult

      protected Boolean handleDatabaseActionResult(DatabaseManager.ActionResult result)
      Handles the results of a database action by informing the user of any non-success states.
      Parameters:
      result - The result obtained from the database.
      Returns:
      True in all cases, as it is assumed that this is not user error.

    • startExecution

      protected final CompletableFuture<Boolean> startExecution()
      Starts the execution of this command. It performs the permission check (See hasPermission()) and runs executeCommand(PermissionsStatus) if the ICommandSender has access to either the user or the admin permission.
      Returns:
      True if the command could be executed successfully or if the command execution failed through no fault of the ICommandSender.

    • executeCommand

      protected abstract CompletableFuture<Boolean> executeCommand(PermissionsStatus permissions)
      Executes the command. This method is only called if validInput() and hasPermission() are true.

      Note that this method is called asynchronously.

      Parameters:
      permissions - Whether the ICommandSender has user and/or admin permissions.
      Returns:
      True if the method execution was successful.

    • getDoor

      protected CompletableFuture<Optional<AbstractDoor>> getDoor(DoorRetriever doorRetriever)
      Attempts to get an DoorBase based on the provided DoorRetrieverFactory and the current ICommandSender.

      If no door is found, the ICommandSender will be informed.

      Parameters:
      doorRetriever - The DoorRetrieverFactory to use
      Returns:
      The DoorBase if one could be retrieved.

    • hasPermission

      protected CompletableFuture<PermissionsStatus> hasPermission()
      Checks if the ICommandSender has the required permissions to use this command. See CommandDefinition#getUserPermission() and CommandDefinition#getAdminPermission().
      Returns:
      A pair of booleans that indicates whether the user has access to the user and admin permission nodes respectively. For both, true indicates that they do have access to the node and false that they do not.
